1.summary: Large 4-BEDROOM semi-detached family home with NO UPWARD CHAIN. Ideally located close to shops, schools, Northern General Hospital and excellent public transport links into Sheffield city centre and Meadowhall. Enclosed rear yard offering off-street parking for 3 vehicles.
1.fullDescription:
We are delighted to bring this large four bedroom semi-detached property to the market which is ideally situated on Barnsley Road. The property has excellent transport links and is located within walking distance to shops, schools and local amenities. This home benefits from 4 large double bedrooms, modern functional kitchen, formal dining room, separate large lounge, gas central heating, and double glazed windows throughout,

This well maintained property comprises from a spacious lounge, separate dining room modern fitted kitchen, cellar entrance and large hallway on the ground floor. To the first floor, there are three generously sized double bedrooms attracting plenty of natural sunlight, landing and three piece bathroom suite with an extra-large shower. Leading to the second floor is a large 4th bedroom with an adjoining ensuite bathroom. To the rear of the top floor is a large storage room.
Outside, the property offers enclosed and secure off-street parking for three vehicles at the rear with direct access into the kitchen and a low maintenance garden to the front.

This property is offered to the market with NO CHAIN and is an Ideal family home offering plenty of storage and conveniently located close to schools, shops, Northern General Hospital and excellent public transport links to Sheffield City Centre and Meadowhall Shopping Centre.

GUIDE PRICE: £320,000.

Call our office for more information and to arrange your viewing.

GROUND FLOOR

Welcoming you home through the front door is a hallway leading to the lounge, dining room and kitchen. Stairs ascending to the first floor.

Lounge: 4.48m x 3.84m
Attracting plenty of natural light, the large lounge comprises of light points, electric and TV points.

Dining Room: 4.07m x 4.53m
Large room comprising of wall mounted gas feature fireplace, light and electric points.

Kitchen: 2.64m x 4.36m
Window overlooking the rear of the property, tiled flooring and light points. Modern fitted kitchen with a 6-burner gas benchtop cooker & electric oven, overhead extractor, wall and base units and inset stainless steel sink.

FIRST FLOOR

Stairs / Landing
Stairs leading to the first floor with a light point.

Bedroom One: 3.28m x 4.33m
Spacious double bedroom with window overlooking the back yard, light and electrical points.

Bedroom Two: 3.54m x 4.40m
Large double bedroom with window overlooking the back yard, light and electrical points.

Bedroom Three: 3.88m x 4.51m
Large street facing double bedroom with bay window light and electrical points.

Bathroom: 1.75m x 2.30m
Having opaque window to the front, light point, tiled flooring, floor to ceiling tiled walls, toilet, wash basin with mixer tap and large shower.

SECOND FLOOR

Bedroom Four: 3.76m x 5.40m
Large double bedroom with side window, light and electrical points. This room has an adjoining ensuite bathroom comprising of a bath and overhead shower, hand basin and toilet.

Storage Room: 3.15m x 7.03m
Large open plan room ideal for storage with light point.

Outside Front
Low maintenance pebbled garden and gate leading onto Barnsley Road.

Outside Rear
Enclosed rear yard with metal gates affording privacy and security, This area has space for 3 vehicles to park off-street.

VIEWINGS
Viewings are highly recommended for you to fully appreciate the potential this lovely home has to offer. Please contact Nicholas or Sue at our office to arrange your viewing or e-mail at All viewings are by appointment only.

Free Valuations

Measurements

Money Laundering

This will include production of their passport or driving licence and a recent utility bill to prove residence. This evidence will be required prior to solicitors being instructed.

General Note
These particulars, whilst believed to be accurate are set out as a general outline only for guidance and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Intending purchasers should not rely on these Particulars of Sale as statements of representation of fact, but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to their accuracy. No person in this agent's employment has the authority to make or give any representation or warranty in respect of the property.

Call our office for more information and to arrange your viewing!

2.fullDescription:
Only on a detailed internal inspection can the true size and standard of accommodation be fully appreciated with this most impressive 3 double bedroom Victorian Villa. The property enjoys an enviable position within this sought after area which boasts an array of excellent amenities on the door step. Millhouses park is also within close proximity, as are very well respected local schools. This sizeable family home is available with the added advantage of no upward chain and must be viewed internally to be fully appreciated. 


The accommodation in brief comprises:

Ground Floor, Entrance porch, hallway with stairs leading down to the basement level and further stairs with an attractive balustrade leading to the first floor, large bay windowed lounge with window seat, separate dining room and spacious kitchen with an excellent range of fitted units.

First Floor, A spacious landing with built in cupboards and access to the loft. Excellent scope is offered to convert the loft space in to additional bedroom space if desired (subject to the necessary consents) Master bedroom with fitted wardrobes across one wall, 2 further spacious double bedrooms and a sizeable family bathroom with a modern white suite.

Exterior, low maintenance garden to the front with a pathway to the side leading to the entrance porch. To the rear is a lawned garden and patio. Beyond which is a large carport which provides off road parking (accessed via Mariott Lane)

Tenure

The property is Leasehold with an 800-year lease from 1892. The ground rent is £35 per year.
features: Excellent amenities including well respected local schools

3.fullDescription:
A fabulous larger style three double bedroom period terrace house situated on this very sought after tree lined road, close to Endcliffe Park. Improved by the present owner to offer beautifully presented and deceptively spacious accommodation over three floors with a light & airy feel.
The side entrance door opens to the side entrance lobby. Bay window lounge, separate dining room with access to the basement cellars providing excellent additional storage space / workshop area. Fitted kitchen with a range of matching units, access from the kitchen to the court yard and gardens.
First Floor: Master bedroom with a superb private en-suite shower room. Double Bedroom two, family bathroom, second floor double bedroom three. Forecourt garden with side pathway to the rear court yard area leading to the rear garden with vegetable plots.
Ranby Road is ideally positioned for local shops and amenities on Ecclesall Road, well-regarded local schools, nearby parks and access to the city centre, train station, universities, hospitals and the Peak District.
Early viewings are strongly advised to avoid disappointment.

4.fullDescription:
We are delighted to offer for sale this Unique Semi-Detached Property situated in the popular residential area near the town centre, of Burngreave Road. With an enclosed aspect to the rear, situated close to an excellent range of local amenities, local doctors surgery, sports complex, great pubs/restaurants, a short distance to the M1 motorway networks, Meadowhall Shopping Centre, Sheffield City Centre, Rotherham, Barnsley, walking distance to the local park, regular bus route and nearby train station. 

This well designed accommodation set across two floors briefly comprises; a fitted kitchen, w.c and two spacious reception rooms currently used as office space.

There is a generous amount of space for future development toward the rear of the property.

The property provides two flats located on the first floor comprising; generous sized bedrooms - fitted kitchens with open plan living areas, ample storage and there is are two three-piece bathrooms.

The interior also benefits from gas central heating, ample storage and fitted double glazing throughout. 

The property offers off street parking to the front on the gated driveway, front pebbled area with potential to extend the driveway for multiple vehicles, additional on street parking and benefiting from an enclosed garden with a patio area.

This property is an ideal investment opportunity full of potential and development opportunities. The property is currently used as office space and two flats with sitting tenants, which could be renovated back to a spacious residential home occupying four bedrooms.
 

Internal viewing highly recommended, not to be missed!

**£350,000.00 - Offers Over.** Please Note - This property is sold with Sitting Tenants & potential to take ownership of 100% shares of the Limited Company.

5.fullDescription:
A fine opportunity has arisen to purchase this stunning three bedroom semi-detached property. Located in this highly desirable residential area, and available with NO CHAIN, the property is well placed for easy access to excellent amenities including Graves Park, St James Retail Park and schools of high repute. The property has been refurbished in recent years and is stylishly decorated throughout, offering spacious accommodation over two floors. Briefly comprises Entrance hall, lounge, dining kitchen and rear utility. Three first floor bedroom and bathroom. Driveway to the front, detached garage and beautifully maintained garden to the rear. Early viewing highly advised.

Entrance Hall

Approached via a front facing uPVC entrance door and having inset spotlights, central heating radiator and stairs rising to the first floor.

Lounge

Stylishly decorated and having a feature gas fireplace, front facing uPVC window and central heating radiator. Glazed doors lead into the;

Dining Kitchen

Having a stunning range of fitted base units with central breakfasting island, all of which incorporate granite worktops, inset sink and drainer and induction range cooker. Inset spotlights, central heating radiator, side and facing uPVC windows and a rear facing uPVC door which leads onto the rear patio.

Utility Room

Providing space for white goods and plumbing for a washing machine. Side and rear facing uPVC windows and rear facing uPVC entrance door.

First Floor

Landing

Having a side facing uPVC window and access to the boarded loft space via pull down loft ladder.

Bedroom One

A large double bedroom having a front facing uPVC window, central heating radiator and coving.

Bedroom Two

A further double bedroom benefiting from a built in airing cupboard, rear facing uPVC window, central heating radiator and coving.

Bedroom Three

Having a built in storage closet, front facing uPVC window and central heating radiator.

Outside

To the front of the property is a pleasant lawned garden, to the side of which stands a driveway large enough to accommodate two cars. Secure gated access leads to the detached garage, which is larger than average and benefits from power, lighting and an electric door.

The rear garden is beautifully maintained and benefits from two patio areas, large lawned garden with border plants and shrubbery, and a summerhouse, all of which is enclosed and offers a good degree of privacy.

6.fullDescription:
GUIDE PRICE £315,000-£325,000
An exceptionally rare opportunity has arisen to purchase this fabulous, period, three bedroomed, multiple bay windowed semi detached family home. Enjoying the huge benefit of full planning permission to extend to the side and rear to create a forever family home this property will be of particular interest to the growing family market looking to create a dream property. Offering the larger style of semi and flooded with light throughout the two floors number 38 has the benefit of a larger than average rear private garden that has direct access to the woods beyond together with a purpose built garden office that is set up to cater for those looking to work from home. Located on this quiet tree lined road in the heart of Beauchief one of Sheffield's most sought after and desirable suburbs within catchment for top performing local schools, numerous amenities are a short stroll and don't forget The Peak District is on the door step. 

VALUER Andy Robinson  

S8 Area Guide
Batemoor, Beauchief, Greenhill, Jordanthorpe, Lowedges, Meersbrook, Norton, Norton Lees, Woodseats

The S8 postcode area covers the South part of the outskirts of Sheffield city centre down towards Dronfield. Covering a vast array of suburbs, the properties range from larger more expensive family homes in the Beauchief area to cosy more affordable homes in the Jordanthorpe, Norton area. This makes S8 a great place to look for your next property whether you want your family's forever home, or if you are just starting out on the property ladder.

At the most southern part of S8, you will find Lowedges, Greenhill, Batemoor and Jordanthorpe. These areas are removed from the hustle and bustle of Sheffield City Centre and the University campuses. There are still plenty of local amenities and with Woodseats and Chesterfield Road only being a 10 minute bus ride away, so if you fancy something a bit more lively then you've not far to go. These suburbs are close to the Dronfield bypass which leads to Chesterfield. If a daily commute is something you are committed to, then this part of S8 is conveniently placed with easy access to the M1.

Greenhill Park situated in Lowedges offers a playground, a bowling green and a skate park. Lowedges Festival is held here on the second Sunday of August each year which demonstrates the community feel of the area. Sheffield Transport Sports Club on Greenhill Main Road offers football pitch hire, practice golf facilities, snooker hire and cricket pitch hire. Also, as you head up toward Norton you will find Graves Health and Sports Centre. Being newly refurbished in 2016 the facilities offer a swimming pool, gym, and various fitness and sports classes.

S8 boasts plenty of green space. Not only is there the aforementioned Greenhill Park, but also Oakes Park, Norton Playing Fields and Meersbrook Park. Meersbrook Park has a playground, 2 bowling greens, a cricket wicket, tennis courts, basketball hoops, a skateboard park and also some woodland area. Graves Park has a playground, cricket pitches, a practice golf course, football pitches, bowling greens, tennis courts and a playground. There are plenty of open grassy areas plus woodland, streams and 3 small lakes. The Rose Garden Café is close to the playground and offers hot and cold food. What makes this park extra special for the little ones however, is Graves Park Animal Farm. Entry is free and here you can find rare farm breeds and smaller animals such as rabbits and guinea pigs. Along with all this parkland, S8 is home to a fair few allotments: Woodseats Allotments, Heeley and Meersbrook Allotments and Warminster Road Allotments.

As with a lot of other areas of Sheffield, S8 offers a wonderful array of choice when it comes to eating out. From bistros, delis, Italians, Mexican, Caribbean and Indian, you can pretty much take your pick with any cuisine you fancy. That Place is voted number 6 on Trip Advisor for Restaurants in Sheffield. No mean feat considering that it is only open in the day between 9am and 3pm. It's speciality of a homemade scotch egg is something not to be missed. If you'd rather be eating out in the evening then Viraaj might be a good choice if you fancy a curry. Winning Yorkshire Restaurant of the year in 2017 in the English Curry Awards this curry house is definitely worth a visit. For something a little bit special then Marco @ Milano is an excellent choice. Serving high end Italian food in a beautiful building, which used to be a police station!

Chesterfield Road is a main arterial route into the city centre, therefore the transport links are very good with buses running frequently. Just off Chesterfield Road is Heeley Retail Park where you can find a Next Clearance, Pets at Home, Boots, Costa Coffee, Matalan and Currys. There are also many independent shops in the vicinity including Pondsfords, which is famous in Sheffield for its fine furniture.

There are a huge choice of nurseries and pre-schools in the S8 area:
Beauchief Pre-School
Beechwood Day Nursery and Pre-School
Brierley Field Children's Nursery Ltd
Bright Horizons Day Nursery and Pre-School
Gresley Road Family Centre Nursery
Chantrey House Nursery and Pre-School
Little Angels Nursery and Pre-School
Norton Grange Children's Nursery
The Little School House Day Nursery and Pre-School

With S8 having so many homes ideal for families, there are also many highly regarded schools in the area:
Abbey Lane Primary
Carfield Primary
Greenhill Primary
Lowedges Primary
Lower Meadow Primary
Meersbrook Bank Primary
Mundella Primary
Norton Free Primary
St Thomas of Canterbury School
Woodseats Primary
Meadowhead School Academy
Newfield

8.summary: This three storey, two bedroom house is sat as an anchor and focus of Horseman Square, located within the popular Little Kelham development. Offering the best views in the whole of Little Kelham, this house has been architect designed with all spaces being created with views and light in mind
8.fullDescription:
This three storey, two bedroom house is sat as an anchor and focus of Horseman Square, located within the popular Little Kelham development. Offering the best views in the whole of Little Kelham, this house has been architect designed with all spaces being created with views and light in mind with plenty of space for storage.

Entering from Horseman Square into the ground floor hallway, which boasts under stair storage, you will access the ground floor bedroom. This spacious bedroom (3.34 meters x 4.02 meters) has plenty of room for a double bed, wardrobes and a desk. It also benefits from an en suite (3.34 meters x 1.58 meters) which features grey porcelain tiles and brushed nickel fittings. All bedrooms feature 50/50 wool blend carpet, with hallways and stairs feature timber hardwood flooring.

The first floor bedroom (3.29 meters x 4.02 meters) has large triple glazed windows which allows views looking down Kelham Island's Goyt. This bedroom is flooded with natural light as well as an ample amount of space for a double bed, wardrobes and a desk. Adjoining the bedroom is the house bathroom (2.71 meters x 1.56 meters) featuring grey porcelain tiles and brushed nickel taps and shower. A small utility space adjoining the bathroom houses the MVHR system which recycles heat and brings in a constant flow of fresh air, reducing heating requirements dramatically.

This house features upside down living with a large, open plan kitchen, dining and living area ( 6.91 meters x 4.02 meters) on the third floor. Being architect designed with space and light in mind, this area has one of the best views in Kelham Island as it looks down along the Goyt. This house includes both an opening Juliet balcony and a natural clay feature wall, incredibly unique characteristics for a house in Kelham Island.

Location

Name in the top ten for hippest places to live in the UK, and winner of the Greatest Neighbourhood in the UK 2018, Kelham Island is the creative heart of Sheffield, and Little Kelham puts you right in the centre of it.

Just a short walk from the city centre, and next to a tram stop, Little Kelham puts all of Sheffield at your fingertips. The train station is just a 23-minute walk away. peddlers market just an eight-minute walk away. The town hall is just a 15-minute walk away and both Sheffield Universities are within a twenty-minute walk.

Kelham Island has it all -you've got sensational cafes, a wide range of award-winning restaurants (even Michelin stars!), an ale trail's worth of quality pubs, and the Kelham Island Museum, all on your doorstep.

You won't ever be lacking for things to do. From live music to retro-gaming arcades, Kelham Island has it all.

Specification

Built to exacting standards and designed to be the height of Scandinavian luxury, high-spec kitchens feature sleek induction hobs and integrated appliances, and Quartz worktops.
Contemporary bathrooms combine flawless tiles with stainless steel fittings, for a stylish, modern look.

Timber flooring covers the open plan kitchen, dining and living room, hallways and stairs. Bedrooms are carpeted a 50/50 wool blend carpet.

Sustainability without compromise

An airtight thermal envelope locks in heat and a Mechanical Ventilation Heat Recovery (MVHR) system brings in a constant flow of fresh air whilst retaining heat given off by people and appliances, significantly lowering the amount of heating a Citu Home needs. This way of building is so effective that gas boilers are no longer required, instead electric heat mats hidden in the walls will be able to provide all the heat your home needs.

This will save over four tonnes of CO2 per year on average, all whilst you enjoy a nice warm home. The Citu Home is designed to make it easy to live sustainably, letting you lower your carbon footprint without having to compromise.

Smart home technology built in as standard

The Citu Home comes with it smart home technology built-in as standard letting you control and monitor your heating from your phone and manage your energy consumption 24/7, all without the need for ugly adapters ruining your Scandi-minimalist look.
features: Large open plan kitchen living and dining room

11.address: Sheldon Road, Nether Edge, S7 1GT - Viewing Recommended
11.summary:
A generously sized 4-bed in the highly popular community of Nether Edge: Sheldon Road.
Having undergone renovation in several rooms, this property requires further works to unleash its fantastic potential as a family home.
11.fullDescription:
Time to explore:
Sheldon Road is situated south of Sheffield city centre in the beloved community of Nether Edge. This is a wonderful area for a whole variety of reasons, one of which is its superb accessibility. Nether Edge enjoys excellent transport links via Abbeydale Road and Chesterfield Road (A61), giving you an easy trip into the city centre and beyond. This makes Sheldon Road a superb home for commuting professionals or anyone who wishes to explore the length and breadth of Sheffield. Nether Edge is also surrounded by a host of excellent local amenities, due in no small part to its enviable location in-between Abbeydale Road and Ecclesall Road. These famous thoroughfares are home to countless excellent businesses, ranging from high street shops and local artisans to delicious cafes and global eateries. This wealth of choice means you will never find yourself lacking in options when planning social occasions or simply treating yourself to a bit of luxury. Nearby green spaces include Meersbrook Park, Broadfield Park and, for the green fingered, the lovely Brincliffe Edge Allotments. Abbeydale Road also gives you access to the glorious Peak District, a route which leads directly to some truly impressive sights such as the magnificent Chatsworth House.
 

Step inside your new home:
You enter Sheldon Road through a long hallway with stairs leading up to the first floor and another set taking you down to the basement for storage use. To your left are two well sized rooms: the living room and the renovated kitchen. The living room is a substantial space with a number of period features to recommend is such as recovered original floorboards, broad alcoves and a high ceiling. A large bay window floods the space with natural light which, together with room for plenty of comfy seating, makes this great for relaxing with friends. The kitchen is a sleek refurbishment with ample storage, contemporary integrated appliances, and stylish design choices such as the exposed brickwork and low hanging lights. The elegant kitchen island doubles as a breakfast bar, turning cooking into a social experience as much as dining together. New French doors lead out to the patio garden, a well-sized environment with a slate courtyard and lots of room for outdoor dining furniture. With some care and attention, this has the potential to become a gorgeous space to enjoy summer days. Back inside, the former kitchen is tucked on the end of the ground floor. This space needs a full refurbishment but, with its generous dimensions, it would make an ideal utility or dining room. Upstairs you will find two large bedrooms, the family bathroom, and the former shower room. Bedrooms 2 will require attention to reach its potential but the vast bedroom 1 has been subject to some attractive renovations, with smart re-plastering and carpets giving you a lovely blank canvas to work with. The former shower room is unfinished but would make an ideal ensuite for bedroom 2. The new family bathroom boasts an immaculate three-piece suite with handy under-sink storage and a shower above the bath. Occupying the second floor are bedrooms 3 and 4, both doubles with plenty of potential for an ambitious homeowner to realise.

Viewing

Strictly by appointment with the auctioneers or

Guide Price: An indication of the seller's current minimum acceptable price at auction. The guide price or range of guide prices is given to assist consumers in deciding whether or not to pursue a purchase. It is usual, but not always the case, that a provisional reserve range is agreed between the seller and auctioneer at the start of marketing. As the reserve is not fixed at this stage and can be adjusted by the seller at any time up to the day of the auction in the light of interest shown during the marketing period, a guide price is issued. This guide price can be shown in the form of a minimum and maximum price range within which an acceptable sale price (reserve) would fall, or as a single price figure within 10% of which the minimum acceptable price (reserve) would fall. A guide price is different to a reserve (see below). Both the guide price and the reserve price can be subject to change up to and including the day of the auction.



Reserve Price: This is the seller's minimum acceptable price at auction and the figure below which the auctioneer cannot sell. The reserve price is not disclosed and remains confidential between the seller and the auctioneer. Both the guide price and the reserve price can be subject to change up to and including the day of the auction.

*Guide Price/Reserve Price
Guide Price: An indication of a seller's minimum expectation at auction and given as a "Guide Price" or a range of "Guide Prices". This is not necessarily the figure a property will sell for and is subject to change prior to the auction.

Reserve Price: Each auction property will be subject to a "Reserve Price" below which the property cannot be sold at auction. Normally the "Reserve Price" will be set within the range of "Guide Prices" or no more than 10% above a single "Guide Price."

Auction Fees
The purchase of this property may include associated fees not listed here, as it is to be sold via auction. To find out more about the fees associated with this property please call Mark Jenkinson & Son, Sheffield on 0114 2760151.

13.address: Birley Rise Road, Birley Carr, Sheffield, S6
13.summary:
Offers in the Region of £275,000

A deceptively spacious, detached house with a fabulous balcony from the living room with fantastic views to the rear, second reception room, fitted kitchen and downstairs WC on the ground floor, 3 double bedrooms and 2 bathrooms on the first floor and a s...
13.fullDescription:
Offers in the Region of £275,000

A deceptively spacious, detached house with a fabulous balcony from the living room with fantastic views to the rear, second reception room, fitted kitchen and downstairs WC on the ground floor, 3 double bedrooms and 2 bathrooms on the first floor and a self contained, open plan living room with a fitted kitchen area and bathroom with a further good sized room to the rear on the lower ground floor.

The side facing door opens into the entrance hallway which has a downstairs WC and wood effect laminate flooring, the living room has a feature fireplace with living flame gas fire inset, sliding patio doors which open onto a good sized balcony which has fabulous views to the rear. There is a second reception room which has a front facing window and two built in storage cupboards. From the hallway, a step descends into the kitchen. There is a pantry/storage cupboard which houses the combination boiler and a range of solid oak base and wall units with laminate work surfaces, a breakfast bar, space for a fridge freezer, a freestanding gas cooker and plumbing for a washing machine.

From the entrance hallway, stairs rise to the spacious first floor landing with ladder access into the loft and a useful over stairs storage cupboard. The master bedroom has a rear facing window with lovely views, fitted wardrobes, a fitted storage cupboard and an en-suite bathroom with a white suite, bath with shower over, WC, basin and chrome towel radiator and is fully tiled. There are two further double bedrooms both with front facing windows. The family bathroom has a white suite, bath with shower over, WC, basin and chrome towel radiator.

There are stairs from the side of the house which descend into the garden. There are sliding patio doors which open into an open plan living room with wood effect laminate flooring, a fitted kitchen and space and plumbing for a washing machine. There is a downstairs bathroom with a white suite, bath with shower over, WC and basin and which also houses a separate combination boiler which powers the central heating system for the lower ground floor. From the living area a door opens into a further good sized room.

Outside to the rear is an enclosed garden with paved area and a lawn with established borders providing privacy with great views. To the side are stairs and a path which leads to the front of the property. To the front is a driveway which provides off road parking for 2/3 vehicles.

Birley Rise Road is ideally placed for access to a good range of local amenities including shops, pubs and schools.

14.summary: This two bedroom house, is sat as an anchor and focus of Horseman Square within the popular Little Kelham development. Offering the best views in the whole of Little Kelham, these houses have been architect designed. All spaces in the houses have been created with views and light in mind.
14.fullDescription:
This two bedroom house, is sat as an anchor and focus of Horseman Square within the popular Little Kelham development. Offering the best views in the whole of Little Kelham, these houses have been architect designed. All spaces in the houses have been created with views and light in mind. This spacious house features 2 bedrooms, an ensuite, a house bathroom and a large open plan kitchen, dining, living area.

Entering from Horseman square onto the ground floor boasts two large, spacious double bedrooms., both of which capitalise on the cascading views of Horseman Square.
Bedroom one (2.54 meters x 4.5 meters) has space for a double bed and wardrobe. The house bathroom (2.39 meters x 1.92 meters) features a brushed nickel shower, taps and grey porcelain tiles throughout. The master bedroom (3.48m meters x 2.8 meters) is a large spacious double bedroom with substantial amounts of space for a double bed, wardrobes and a desk. It also benefits from a large ensuite (1.72 meters x 1.76 meters). A small utility space underneath the stairs houses the MVHR system which recycles heat and brings in a constant flow of fresh air, reducing heating requirements dramatically.

Heading up to the first floor, you will reach the brightly lit "L" shape upstairs space which has been designed to actively delineate three separate areas; kitchen, living and dining (7.36meters x 7.1 meters) . Making it the ideal area to entertain friends and family. Triple glazed windows throughout ensure natural lighting, as well as views of the cascading roofscape of Little Kelham and the wider surrounding area. This large open plan living space includes a natural clay feature wall, one of the unique characteristics of this house type.

Location

Name in the top ten for hippest places to live in the UK, and winner of the Greatest Neighbourhood in the UK 2018, Kelham Island is the creative heart of Sheffield, and Little Kelham puts you right in the centre of it.

Just a short walk from the city centre, and next to a tram stop, Little Kelham puts all of Sheffield at your fingertips. The train station is just a 23-minute walk away. peddlers market just an eight-minute walk away. The town hall is just a 15-minute walk away and both Sheffield Universities are within a twenty-minute walk.

Kelham Island has it all -you've got sensational cafes, a wide range of award-winning restaurants (even Michelin stars!), an ale trail's worth of quality pubs, and the Kelham Island Museum, all on your doorstep.

You won't ever be lacking for things to do. From live music to retro-gaming arcades, Kelham Island has it all.

Specification

Built to exacting standards and designed to be the height of Scandinavian luxury, high-spec kitchens feature sleek induction hobs and integrated appliances, and Quartz worktops.

Contemporary bathrooms combine flawless tiles with stainless steel fittings, for a stylish, modern look.

Timber flooring covers the open plan kitchen, dining and living room, hallways and stairs. Bedrooms are carpeted a 50/50 wool blend carpet.

Sustainability without compromise

An airtight thermal envelope locks in heat and a Mechanical Ventilation Heat Recovery (MVHR) system brings in a constant flow of fresh air whilst retaining heat given off by people and appliances, significantly lowering the amount of heating a Citu Home needs. This way of building is so effective that gas boilers are no longer required, instead electric heat mats hidden in the walls will be able to provide all the heat your home needs.

This will save over four tonnes of CO2 per year on average, all whilst you enjoy a nice warm home. The Citu Home is designed to make it easy to live sustainably, letting you lower your carbon footprint without having to compromise.

Smart home technology built in as standard

The Citu Home comes with it smart home technology built-in as standard letting you control and monitor your heating from your phone and manage your energy consumption 24/7, all without the need for ugly adapters ruining your Scandi-minimalist look.

15.fullDescription:
Located on this popular road in S11 which is ideal for students who attend Hallam University, is this fantastic four double bedroom mid terraced HMO property which is Article 4 compliant. Well presented throughout the property currently generates an annual income of £21,840 (inclusive of bills) which represents an excellent return on investment. The property has been relatively recently renovated throughout with a contemporary fitted kitchen which is open plan to the living area, two shower rooms and four double bedrooms. It further benefits from a utility area in the cellar and a private courtyard to the rear. An early internal viewing is highly recommended to avoid disappointment.

Ideally located just off the lower stretch of Ecclesall Road, and therefore enjoying excellent access to a range of shops, pubs and restaurants including Waitrose, Marks and Spencers Food, Tesco and Sainsbury's together with various coffee shops, including Starbucks and Costa. Both Sheffield Hallam University City and Collegiate Campus are within walking distance. Sheffield City Centre and the train station are approximately half a mile away.

16.summary: **** GUIDE PRICE  £275,000 to £280,000 **** The perfect four bedroom semi detached home, situated on a quaint cul de sac in the popular village of Handsworth, Sheffield.
16.fullDescription: A property viewing is highly recommended to appreciate what this lovely home has to offer. A superb four bedroom semi detached house, nestled in a quiet cul de sac. The property has had a degree of upgrades and the double storey extension creates beautiful features on the ground and first floor. These include a stunning open plan kitchen / diner with bifolding doors onto the patio and a large master bedroom with an ensuite shower room. The living accommodation briefly comprises of; entrance porch, hallway, open plan dining/kitchen area, living room, utility room, W/C and a garage. The newly fitted country shaker style kitchen is equipped with a freestanding cooker, large extractor fan and a range of cupboards and units. This kitchen really is the perfect area for cooking and entertaining. Following on from the kitchen is a matching utility room and a downstairs W/C with access into the garage. The living room can also be found on the ground floor and offers a feature fireplace and a large bay window allowing in a lot of natural light. Specifications include: security alarm system, gas central heating and double glazing. To the first floor there are four bedrooms, the master offering an en suite shower room, and family bathroom comprising of panel enclosed bath, wash basin and a low flush W/C. The property has been newly plastered throughout but may require some finishing touches in places. To the front of the property is the driveway leading to the integral garage with power and light. The rear garden has a patio area with the remainder laid to lawn and has the added bonus of separate side access. This is a rare opportunity to buy a property of this style so don't delay and call our sales experts for a viewing today, .

17.fullDescription:
A three bedroom bay window mid terrace family home sold with no onward chain and offering an excellent purchase for the first time buyer.

This lovely home briefly comprises;
Lounge with bay window, dining room with wood burner and cellar access and off shot fitted kitchen. To the first floor are two bedrooms and a family bathroom. A staircase rises to very spacious attic bedroom three. Externally, to the front of the property is a fore garden whilst to the rear is a garden with lawn and patio area.

This well presented property is well worthy of an internal inspection. Book your viewing today!

To the front of the property is a large block paved driveway leading to the covered carport and detached garage. The beautiful rear garden is generously sized and fully enclosed.

The sought after area of Charnock is well placed for a good range of local amenities including Supertram stop, local shops and reputable schooling. Sheffield city centre is within easy reach together with the Derbyshire countryside and Crystal Peaks shopping centre.

Available now with no onward chain Hunters are proud to be bring to market this 3 bedroom mid terraced house in the ever popular location of Nether Green. Well presented throughout the property has been well looked after by the current owners and offers an exciting opportunity for new buyers to make their home. Nether Green is conveniently situated in the south west of Sheffield and benefits from unrivalled access to nearby local amenities, excellent local schooling and the nearby Peak National Park. In brief the accommodation comprises; living room, dining kitchen, two first floor bedrooms, bathroom with 3 piece suite and a further attic bedroom to the second floor. We would strongly recommend an internal inspection to be able to appreciate the size and quality of the accommodation on offer.

24.fullDescription:
***Guide Price £260,000 - £270,000***
Hunters Hillsborough are delighted to present a stone-built semi detached family home on a private cul de sac located in the heart of Wadsley Bridge. With accommodation over 3 levels, large garage and a private garden this property really does have it all. The driveway leads up to the super-sized garage with an up and over garage door. A UPVC door leads straight into the lobby area of the garage and through to the rear garden, a great entrance after a day in the park or dog walking! Entrance to the property via the front door into the entrance hall with a good size W/C finished in a white suite with W/C and sink basin. Large under stairs storage cupboard. The ground floor has a fantastic multifunctional open plan family living area comprising a kitchen with a good range of wall and base units finished in light wood fronts with grey work surfaces, built-in electric oven with gas hob and space for all usual kitchen appliances. Occasional lounge/dining area with French doors leading out to south facing sun soaked private garden. The first floor has a relaxing lounge with dual aspect windows and French doors with Juliette Balcony. Double bedroom overlooking the back garden. Stairs to the 2nd floor with two further double bedrooms and the family bathroom. Corner bath with shower over bath, sink basin and W/C finished with white tiles and mosaic border, two Velux windows finish off the room. The property has a low maintenance pebbled area to the front of the property with stone built walls and mature shrubs. The back garden is a good size with a patio area perfect for garden furniture and BBQ’s along with an established lawn.
Baxter Mews is a relatively new addition to the Wadsley Bridge area and is a private estate behind the Mill. There's a good selection of local pubs in the area and the Kilner Way retail park, Asda Supermarket and Sainsburys are within walking distance. Fantastic public transport available from Halifax Road.

KITCHEN/DINER 11' 10" x 11' 10" (3.61m x 3.61m)

Larger than average three-bedroom stone-fronted mid-terrace on a quiet road in Crookes. Great property for a first-time buyer as it's a short walk to Crookes shops but also walking distance to Broomhill, Sheffield University, many hospitals and the city centre.

Coming into the property through the back door, initially, there is a porch then it leads into the dining kitchen. The dining kitchen has plenty of character with exposed brick chimney breast and large timber cupboards to the side. The kitchen itself is a Shaker style with units above/below the worktop and bevelled tile splashback. In terms of appliances, there is an electric oven with an extractor fan above, an integrated fridge and a dishwasher. In the corner of the kitchen is access to the cellar.

Across the bottom of the stairs is the living room with a window at the front and an external door to the side. Again, there are character features here including tall skirting boards, picture rail and bespoke storage cupboard to the side of the chimney breast.

On the first floor are two bedrooms and the bathroom. Bedroom one is at the front of the property, this is a large double bedroom with a built-in storage cupboard under the stairs to the second floor. Bedroom two is a smaller double at the back of the property. Nextdoor is the bathroom, which has a washbasin, large shower cubicle, washbasin and towel radiator.

In the attic is bedroom three is another large double bedroom with a Velux window at the back of the property.

Externally at front of the property is a small forecourt. The South facing rear garden has a decked area outside the property and an outhouse that comes with the property. One neighbour has rights of way across the rear garden.

General information
The property tenure is leasehold, there are approximately 687 years remaining on the lease, the ground rent is £8 per year.

43.fullDescription:
Offered to the open market with no onward chain is this newly refurbished four bedroom mid terraced house which is located within the convenient and popular area of Highfields. Well presented throughout with neutral décor the property has been re-wired, re-plumbed, benefits from new windows, two new shower rooms and an impressive new open plan kitchen diner. Measuring almost 1200 square feet in total the accommodation on the ground floor comprises a bay windowed living room to the front aspect which has stripped wood floor, and an open plan dining kitchen to the rear which has continued strip wood flooring and a range of white fitted units with contrasting worktops. From here there is access to both the rear garden and cellar head. On the first floor there is a double bedroom to the front aspect which has a fitted cupboard, a second bedroom to the rear aspect and a shower room. From the landing area stairs lead to the attic where you will find two further bedrooms and a second shower room. Outside there is a small area to the front of the property which sets it back from the road while to the rear there is a south west facing garden that has no through access for neighbouring properties and has been landscaped to provide a lawn area and paved patio areas. An early internal viewing is highly recommended.

An extremely convenient position offering easy access to Sheffield City Centre which enjoys all of the many benefits and amenities that you would expect of such a busy and vibrant City Centre. Sheffield rail station is just over 1 mile away as is the Sheffield parkway which links to the M1 motorway network. Both London Road and Ecclesall Road are within walking distance where you will find a plethora of fabulous restaurants, pubs, cafés and a host of independent shops along with many well recognised high street outlets.

The accommodation comprises an entrance hallway, staircase to first floor and convenient under stairs storage cupboard. Hunters Estate Agents are delighted to present a spacious bay fronted 3 bedroom terrace house in the extremely popular residential district of Walkley. Boasting original features and an outstanding view, this impressive and beautifully proportioned property is offered for sale with no chain. Set back off the road with steps to the front of the property although regular access is usually via the back door. The kitchen diner is a light and airy space with a good range of wall and base units, built in electric oven and gas hob with extractor above. Space for all usual appliances. A stunning stone floor runs throughout the kitchen diner, hardwearing and very pleasant under foot. Access to the cellar predominantly used for storage. Through to the relaxing lounge, a large room with almost floor to ceiling bay window with wooden sash window frames. Stripped back original flooring and a feature fireplace finish this beautiful room. The first floor has a double bedroom with original exposed flooring and stunning views, further good sized bedroom and the family bathroom with white 3 piece suite comprising bath, shower over bath, W/C and sink basin. Stairs rise to attic bedroom 3 with velux window and ceiling spotlights. Storage in the eaves and laminate flooring. Delightful low maintenance rear garden with patio area and steps leading up past a small lawn to a further patio area.
Given the location of this property you have the added benefit of easy access to Hillsborough, Walkley and Crookes amenities including bars, restaurants and local shops. Just a short walk to surrounding countryside including Rivelin Valley.

With no chain, this would be an excellent house for a first time buyer or young families having good school catchment or to an investor.

Crookes has comprehensive shopping facilities and excellent local public houses. Sheffield Royal Hallamshire Hospital, Children's Hospital and Weston Park are all within one and half miles making this an ideal spot for Hospital and University staff.

***BEAUTIFULLY PRESENTED THROUGHOUT*** Blundells are proud to bring to market this superb four bedroom detached townhouse, located in the highly popular residential area of Gleadless, well placed for a good range of amenities including primary and secondary schools, shops and transport links.
This beautiful property offers spacious living accommodation over four floors which has been finished to a very high standard. The property boasts a stunning kitchen diner, living room with access to the rear garden, four bedrooms including one en-suite, family bathroom with an enclosed rear garden, driveway and an integral garage with electric shutter door. Offered for sale with the benefits of gas central heating and uPVC double glazing.
***Viewing is highly recommended***

Briefly the property comprises of:-
The main entrance to the property leads into the entrance hallway with access to the integral garage and additional storage room. The stairs lead to the first-floor landing and the well-presented living room with access to the rear garden via large bi-fold patio doors which include added extra roller shutters giving additional security.
The stunning kitchen diner offers a white gloss finish and benefits from integrated appliances throughout including an electric oven and induction hob, fridge freezer, washing machine and dishwasher. There is space for a dining table and chairs with an additional small storage cupboard/pantry.
Also available on the first floor is a modern WC.

The second-floor landing leads to the spacious master bedroom and en-suite shower room. Bedroom two is also located on the second floor and can accommodate a king size bed.
Finally, the modern family bathroom has a bath with an overhead shower, wash basin & WC.

The third floor offers two further bedrooms which both accommodate double beds and furniture, one of which has a large sky light allowing a significant amount of light into the room.

Externally: The front of the property offers a driveway and integral garage with electric roller door. Moreover, it benefits from added security in the form of bespoke gates designed specifically for the property.
The rear low maintenance garden is fully enclosed and offers a sizeable, decked seating area and access to the front of the property via stairs located on the side of the property.

Gleadless is a highly popular residential suburb known for its superb local amenities in the form of shops, primary and secondary schools and public transport links.
This property is Ideally placed for links to both the M1 motorway networks and access to Sheffield city centre.

To arrange your viewing please call Blundells now on .

66.fullDescription:
Guide Price £275,000 - £290,000

A lovely well-proportioned three bedroom mid terraced house which is located within the highly sought after suburb of Greystones benefitting from a superb array of local amenities and excellent local schools. The property offers flexible and versatile living accommodation over three floors.
On the ground floor the side entrance door opens to the entrance lobby, a bay windowed living room with feature fireplace. The dining room has rear facing windows with garden views, access to the cellar. Off shot kitchen with a range of fitted matching units and garden views.
On the first floor is a master bedroom with windows and a deep fitted cupboard, a second well-proportioned bedroom and a family bathroom with a shower over the bath. From the landing area stairs lead to a wonderful and spacious attic bedroom which has useful eaves storage and dual aspect windows. Outside to the rear is a fantastic enclosed garden and a brick built outbuilding.

The property is situated close to Endcliffe Park and Ecclesall Road. A popular and highly desirable location with an excellent array of shops, bars and restaurants. It offers easy access in to the city centre with regular bus routes convenient for access to hospitals and universities and in less than four miles you can reach the superb open spaces of the Peak District.

It’s easy to see why this highly sought-after residential area is so popular with professional persons and young families alike.
Early viewings are strongly advised.

Beautifully presented three bedroom semi-detached home in Norton Lees. Internally the property has recently benefitted from a new kitchen and bathroom, the property also comes with off-street parking and good size rear garden and incredible views.

Upon walking through the door on the side of the property there is a small hallway, to left are stairs to the first floor and straight ahead is the door to the living room. The living room is a good size with a bay window at the front of the property and a chimney breast on the party wall.

At the back of the living room is access to the kitchen/diner, the brand new kitchen has modern grey gloss units above and below the quartz effect worktop. In terms of appliances, there is an integrated fridge/freezer, electric oven with electric hob and extractor fan above. On the other side of the room is space for a breakfast table and chairs, there is also access to a large storage cupboard under the stairs, in here is the Ideal combination boiler and space/plumbing for a washing machine. From the kitchen are new French doors that open onto the rear decking.

On the first floor are three bedrooms and a bathroom. Bedroom one is at the front of the property, this is a large double bedroom with a bay window at the front. Bedroom two is another double bedroom at the back of the property with stunning views towards the city centre. Nextdoor is the new bathroom that has a white three piece suite including a bath with shower above, WC and washbasin. Bedroom three is a single bedroom/study/nursery at the front of the property.

Externally at the front of the property, there is off-street parking for one car and a low maintenance garden to the side. There is access from the front to the rear down the side of the property. The rear garden has a storage garage at the side and raised deck directly at the back of the house. There is then a lawn with surrounding flowerbeds.

General information
The property tenure is leasehold, the lease is for 1000 years from 7th November 1933. The Ideal combination boiler is approximately 19 months old. The property has been fully rewired in the last 6 months.

This attractive 3 bedroom extended semi-detached home is nestled in the popular residential area of Frecheville and is well placed for access to local amenities (including reputable primary and secondary schools) whilst having excellent transport links. 

This impressive and beautifully proportioned property offers flexible living accommodation, a gas central heating system, and double glazing throughout. The property has been extended to the rear by the current owner, had a new kitchen, shower room, and downstairs WC fitted, and has also recently had new fascias, guttering, and soffits installed.

The property briefly comprises of a front porch, a spacious lounge, a dining room (with built-in storage), a fitted kitchen, a rear porch, a downstairs WC, three bedrooms (with both the master bedroom and bedroom 2 having the additional benefit of fitted wardrobes), a landing and a shower room featuring a three-piece suite. There is also access to the loft via the landing.

To the rear of the property, there is a generous beautifully landscaped low-maintenance garden featuring a large decked area, tarmac, a larger than average garage, and a garden room/man cave (with power and lighting). There is also the highlight of an outdoor tap and several outdoor electrical points.

To the front and side of the property, there is a private driveway providing ample off-street parking.

Early viewing is essential to avoid missing out on this superb home!
